answers.answer: No, this doesn't sound right.Normally a combination of synthyroid and cytomel would be given.  If you are taking cytomel, it should also be spread out through the day (ie. multiple dosing) not all at once.I would be rechecking on this or getting a second opinion.  Another option considering that your FT3 is low is to switch to 'natural thyroid' whcih contains T3, T4 and other trace hormones.  Armor is one, dessicated thyroid (erfa brand from canada), or compounded from pharmacy.
While you are switching, you should switch doctors also.  Your doctor clearly does not have a clue.Please post the reference ranges shown on the lab report for those tests.

OMG, where did the doctor get the idea to take you off of T4 and give you just T3? And why is 1.0 a good level for FT4? Yikes!!! Most hypos feel better with FT4 in the upper ranges, so I don't understand why the doc wouldn't raise your T4 and add Cytomel.Get a new doc, pronto.I found my new endo off this website:http://www.thyroid-info.com/topdrs/Make sure the doc specializes in thyroid, not just diabetes.:) Tamra
